greeting: Welcome to ash-lanta! This is the current ash Flash Briefing for today
weather: <break time="1.5s"/>It's 59 degrees and sunny today. There is a 10% chance of rain
story1: <break time="1.5s"/>If you are looking for registration or need to pick up meeting materials, you can find them in Hall A-1
story2: <break time="1.5s"/>Friday Satellite symposia<break time="100ms"/> will occur this morning, afternoon, and later this evening. The morning symposia<break time="100ms"/> will occur from 7:00 AM to 11:00 AM at the Atlanta Marriott mark key and Georgia World Congress Center. The afternoon symposia<break time="100ms"/> will take place from 12:30 to 4:30 PM
story3: <break time="1.5s"/>Trainee Day will occur from 12:00 PM to 5:00 PM at the Omni Atlanta Hotel at CNN Center, which is next door to the convention center. Trainees are encouraged to attend. No tickets are required. Registrants with a blue name badge will be admitted
story4: <break time="1.5s"/>Friday Scientific Workshops are interactive discussions of the latest science developments in a particular field of hematology. There are six occurring this afternoon beginning at 1:00 PM at the convention center
story5: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers subsidized child care for parents who are meeting participants. If you did not make a reservation in advance, check in with the child care center in A-410 to make a reservation. The rate is $5.00 per hour
story6: <break time="1.5s"/>that's it for now. We'll have another update this afternoon

story1: <break time="1.5s"/>The Global Capacity-Building Showcase is a new annual meeting poster category designed to showcase research and capacity-building initiatives in lower and middle income countries. Be sure to check these out in Hall A-2
story2: <break time="1.5s"/>Education Program and Scientific Program sessions will start the ash meeting off this morning from 7:30 to 9:00 AM. A limited number of oral abstract sessions are happening from 7:30 to 9:00 AM
story3: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers a lounge just for Trainees where you can meet other Trainees and learn about opportunities with ash. The Trainee Lounge is in ash Central in Hall B-1
story4: <break time="1.5s"/>The next coffee break is at 9:00 AM in the Poster Hall in Hall A-2. You can view posters there all day too
story5: a<break time="1.5s"/>sh offers subsidized child care for parents who are meeting participants. If you did not make a reservation in advance, check in with the child care center in A-410 to make a reservation. The rate is $5.00 per hour
story6: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers dedicated lounges that will be available for nursing mothers in safe, accessible areas throughout the convention center. Each nursing mother’s lounge will provide a private, comfortable area equipped with lockable doors, furniture, and power outlets to use for pumping sessions during the ash annual meeting. story7: <break time="1.5s"/>that's it for now. We'll have another update later this morning

story4: <break time="1.5s"/>The Ham-Wasserman Lecture will be presented at 12:30 PM in Hall C2 and C3
story5: <break time="1.5s"/>It is not too late to register to participate in the ash Foundation Run Walk, which occurs tomorrow morning at 7:30 AM.  You can register in Hall B-1. story6: <break time="1.5s"/>The exhibit hall is open until 5:00 p.m. in Halls B2-B4.  There is a lot of good information available in the exhibit hall, and product theaters will begin at 11:30 a.m
story7: <break time="1.5s"/>If you need a new professional photo to be taken, you can do this at headshot alley in the exhibit hall in the B-4 section.  Lab coats are available for use in the photo
story8: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers subsidized child care for parents who are meeting participants.  If you did not make a reservation in advance, check in with the child care center in A-410 to make a reservation. The rate is $5.00 per hour
story9: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers dedicated lounges that will be available for nursing mothers in safe, accessible areas throughout the convention center. That's it for now. We'll have another update later today

story1: <break time="1.5s"/>Today is the last day to view the Global Capacity-Building Showcase, which is a new annual meeting poster category designed to showcase research and capacity-building initiatives in lower- and middle-income countries. Be sure to check these out in Hall A-2
story2: <break time="1.5s"/>The E. Donnall Thomas Lecture and Prize will occur at 9:00 to 10:00 AM in Hall C2 and C3. Coffee is available from 10:00 AM until 10:30 AM in the Exhibit Hall in Halls B2 through B4. A limited number of Education Program sessions will commence at 10:30 AM through 12:00 PM. A full complement of oral abstract sessions are happening from 10:30 through 12:00 PM
story3: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers a lounge just for Trainees where you can meet other Trainees and learn about opportunities with ash. The Trainee Lounge is in ash Central in Hall B-1
story4: <break time="1.5s"/>Today is the last day to visit the exhibit hall. The exhibit hall will be open 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM in Halls B2 through B4. There is a lot of good information available in the exhibit hall, and product theaters will begin at 12:15 PM
story5: <break time="1.5s"/>If you need a new professional photo to be taken, you can do this at Headshot Alley in the exhibit hall in the B-4 section. Lab coats are available for use in the photo
story6: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers subsidized child care for parents who are meeting participants. If you did not make a reservation in advance, check in with the child care center in A-410 to make a reservation. The rate is $5.00 per hour
story7: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers dedicated lounges that will be available for nursing mothers in safe, accessible areas throughout the convention center. Each nursing mother’s lounge will provide a private, comfortable area equipped with lockable doors, furniture, and power outlets to use for pumping sessions during the ash annual meeting. A refrigerator will be available in the child care room for safe storage. For exact lactation room locations, please refer to the annual meeting app or to the printed ash Campus Map
story8: <break time="1.5s"/>A complimentary light lunch will be available today from 12:00 to 1:30 PM in the exhibit hall in the Hall B-4 section. Please have your lunch ticket ready that was provided with your name badge credentials
story9: <break time="1.5s"/>that's it for now. We'll have another update this afternoon

story2: <break time="1.5s"/>The exhibit hall closes at 2:00 PM in Halls B2 through B4. This is your last chance to visit with industry
story3: <break time="1.5s"/>If you are starting to run out of steam this afternoon, coffee will be available at 4:00 PM until 4:30 PM in the Poster Hall in Hall A-2
story4: <break time="1.5s"/>Collaboration Rooms are available for 45-minute meetings with colleagues that you are collaborating with. You can reserve a room for 10 or 20 people in Hall B-1

greeting: Alexa hopes you are enjoying your visit to ash-lanta! This is the current ash Flash Briefing for Monday
weather: <break time="1s"/>It's 59 degrees and sunny today. There is a 10% chance of rain
story1: <break time="1.5s"/>If you are starting to run out of steam this afternoon, coffee will be available at 4:00 PM until 4:30 PM in the Poster Hall in Hall A-2
story2: <break time="1.5s"/>If you are tired of sitting and want to get some exercise, you can watch sessions on a treadmill or stationary bike at ash Live: Remote Session Viewing in Hall B-1
story3: <break time="1.5s"/>Oral abstract sessions are happening from 4:30 to 6:00 PM. ash-FDA Joint Symposium on New Drug Approvals in Acute Myeloid Leukemia will be presented from 4:30 to 6:00 PM in Hall C2 and C3. The Special Symposium on the Basic Science of Hemostasis and Thrombosis will be presented from 4:30 to 6:30 PM in the Sidney Marcus Auditorium in the A Building
story4: <break time="1.5s"/>ash offers a poster reception tonight from 6:00 to 8:00 PM in the Poster Hall. I hear the warm pretzels and beer are the highlight for many people! When you go to the poster reception, be sure to view the Global Capacity-Building Showcase too
story5: <break time="1.5s"/>Attend the event designed for women in hematology. The ash Networking Reception for Female Hematologists will occur tonight from 7:30 to 9:00 PM at the Omni
story6: <break time="1.5s"/>There are lots of restaurants downtown, and you may want to consider midtown and new developments at Krog Street Market, Ponce City Market, and others along the Beltline in East Atlanta, which are just a short cab ride away. Restaurant and dining assistance is available in the International Concourse between Buildings A and B
story7: <break time="1.5s"/>that's it for now. We'll have another update this evening

When you go to the poster reception, be sure to view the Global Capacity-Building Showcase too. Attend the event designed for women in hematology. The ash Networking Reception for Female Hematologists will occur tonight from 7:30 to 9:00 PM at the Omni. No plans for dinner? There are lots of restaurants downtown, and you may want to consider midtown and new developments at Krog Street Market, Ponce City Market, and others along the Beltline in East Atlanta, which are just a short cab ride away. Restaurant and dining assistance is available in the International Concourse between Buildings A and B. Good night and enjoy Southern Hospitality in ash-lanta! Thanks for making today’s ash great
